title: 113_s1797
content: The Act titled "Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2013" extends the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Program. The Emergency Unemployment Compensation Program is extended until January 1, 2015, with funding amendments included in the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2013. The effective date of these changes is retroactive to the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012. SEC. 3. TEMPORARY EXTENSION OF EXTENDED BENEFIT PROVISIONS. The Assistance for Unemployed Workers and Struggling Families Act is amended to extend deadlines to December 31, 2014 and June 30, 2015. The Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2008 is also amended to extend the deadline to June 30, 2015. The Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 is amended to extend the deadline to December 31, 2014. The amendments extend deadlines to December 31, 2014 and update the effective date to align with the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012. SEC. 4 extends funding for reemployment services and eligibility assessment activities through fiscal year 2015. SEC. 5 provides additional extended unemployment benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. The Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act is amended to extend benefits until June 30, 2014 and December 31, 2014. Funds can be used to cover the cost of extended benefits provided before and after the amendments. The Railroad Retirement Board is appropriated $250,000 for administrative expenses related to extended unemployment benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act amendments. The enactment of this Act allows States whose agreement under title IV of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2008 was terminated in 2013 to enter into subsequent agreements if they meet the requirements.
